Question
========
  
Based on two independently and randomly drawn samples 1 and 2, one tests that population 1 has higher average scores on a given variable than population 2. Of both samples is given: sample 1: n = 10, mean = 54, s = 5 Sample 2: n = 9, mean = 48, s = 12

What is the realized absolute value of the test quantity when testing the hypothesis set with the t-test ?

  
Answerlist
----------
* 0.35
* 0.66
* 1.45
* 4.54
